alert.note: Alert for East Feliciana; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 11:41AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern St. Helena, eastern East Feliciana and northwestern Tangipahoa Parishes, southwestern Pike and southeastern Amite Counties through 1215 PM CST... At 1141 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clinton, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Greensburg, Kentwood, Osyka, Darlington, Gillsburg, Easleyville and Tangipahoa. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 57 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: East Feliciana; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena
